If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online.Job SummaryðŸ“Œ About VistraVistra is a Fortune 500 integrated retail electricity and power generation company. Our Power Optimization Center (POC) leverages advanced monitoring, diagnostics, and optimization technologies to ensure reliability, efficiency, and innovation across our diverse fleet of generation assets â€” including solar power.ðŸš€ Internship OverviewWe are seeking a Summer 2026 Intern to join our POC team with a focus on Solar Power Generation systems and operations. This role is ideal for students pursuing renewable energy, electrical engineering, or related disciplines who want to apply their academic knowledge to real-world challenges in the energy sector. Interns will gain exposure to solar plant performance monitoring, diagnostics, and optimization strategies that support efficient and sustainable operations.Job DescriptionðŸ›  Key ResponsibilitiesAssist in analyzing solar plant operational data to identify performance trends, anomalies, and optimization opportunities.Support the development of diagnostic tools and models for solar system monitoring.Collaborate with engineers to evaluate efficiency metrics, reliability indicators, and renewable integration strategies.Contribute to projects that enhance workflow automation and visualization systems for solar operations.Document findings and present project outcomes to the POC team and leadership.Will be assigned various engineering projects.ã€€Comply with safety policy and procedures to ensure a safe working environmentPossess the ability to work independently and in a fast paced environmentAll other duties as assignedðŸŽ“ QualificationsPursuing a Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Renewable Energy, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.Familiarity with solar power systems, photovoltaic technology, or energy generation fundamentals.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with interest in data-driven decision-making.Proficiency in at least one programming language (Python, MATLAB, C++, or similar) preferred.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.Excellent communication skills for presenting technical concepts clearly.Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident. Students sponsored through Optical Practical Training (OPT) or Curricular Practical Training (CPT) areã€€NOTã€€eligible for this internship.Official transcripts must be received from your school prior to start dateMust be in good academic standing with your schoolðŸŒ± What Youâ€™ll GainHands-on experience with solar power generation monitoring and optimization in a real-world setting.Exposure to enterprise-scale diagnostic systems within Vistraâ€™s POC.Mentorship from experienced renewable energy engineers and analysts.Opportunity to present your work to senior leadership and contribute to operational innovation in solar energy.Job FamilyGeneral ServicesCompanyLuminant Generation Company LLCLocationsIrving, TexasTexasWe are a company of people committed to:Â  Exceeding Customer Expectations, Great People, Teamwork, Competitive Spirit and Effective Communication.Â  If this describes you, then apply today!If you currently work for Vistra or its subsidiaries, please apply via the internal career site. It is the policy of the Company to comply with all employment laws and to afford equal employment opportunity to individuals in all aspects of employment, including in selection for job opportunities, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military service, protected veteran status, or any other consideration protected by federal, state or local laws.Â If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance submitting an application or would like to request an accommodation, please email usÂ atÂ assistance@vistraenergy.comÂ toÂ make a request.

If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online.Job SummaryðŸ“Œ About VistraVistra is a leading Fortune 500 integrated retail electricity and power generation company, committed to innovation, reliability, and sustainability. Our Power Optimization Center (POC) is at the forefront of leveraging technology to optimize operations, improve reliability, and support energy generation.ðŸš€ Internship OverviewWe are seeking a Summer 2026 Intern to join our POC team with a focus on developing digital agents within Vistra LLM software platform. This role offers hands-on experience in applying AI-driven automation to real-world operational challenges in the energy sector.Job DescriptionðŸ›  Key ResponsibilitiesDesign, build, and test digital agents to support day-to-day monitoring and diagnostics operations.Collaborate with engineers and analysts to identify opportunities for workflow automation and decision support tools.Integrate digital agents with existing data pipelines, APIs, and visualization dashboards.Document development processes and provide recommendations for scaling digital agent capabilities.Present project outcomes to the POC team and leadership at the end of the internship.Comply with safety policy and procedures to ensure a safe working environmentPossess the ability to work independently and in a fast paced environmentAll other duties as assignedðŸŽ“ QualificationsCurrently pursuing a Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.Familiarity with Python, C#, or JavaScript; experience with APIs and automation frameworks preferred.Interest in AI/ML, digital agents, and workflow automation.Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and collaboratively.Excellent communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences.Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident. Students sponsored through Optical Practical Training (OPT) or Curricular Practical Training (CPT) areã€€NOTã€€eligible for this internship.Official transcripts must be received from your school prior to start dateMust be in good academic standing with your schoolðŸŒ± What Youâ€™ll GainHands-on experience with various Large Language Models (LLMs) and enterprise-scale monitoring systems.Exposure to AI-driven automation in the energy industry.Mentorship from experienced engineers and analysts in Vistraâ€™s POC.Opportunity to present your work to senior leadership and contribute to operational innovation.Job FamilyGeneral ServicesCompanyLuminant Generation Company LLCLocationsIrving, TexasTexasWe are a company of people committed to:Â  Exceeding Customer Expectations, Great People, Teamwork, Competitive Spirit and Effective Communication.Â  If this describes you, then apply today!If you currently work for Vistra or its subsidiaries, please apply via the internal career site. It is the policy of the Company to comply with all employment laws and to afford equal employment opportunity to individuals in all aspects of employment, including in selection for job opportunities, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military service, protected veteran status, or any other consideration protected by federal, state or local laws.Â If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance submitting an application or would like to request an accommodation, please email usÂ atÂ assistance@vistraenergy.comÂ toÂ make a request.

If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online.Job SummaryðŸ“Œ About VistraVistra is a Fortune 500 integrated retail electricity and power generation company.
